title: More efficient disk sorting logic needed for handling border values in row values
OB: The current logic for processing disk sorting when there is a border value for row value is not efficient.
EB: A more efficient logic is expected to be implemented for processing disk sorting when there is a border value for row value. Instead of saving the file as a temp file and then calling it to memory for sorting, the data should be sorted directly in memory and then written to the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort 40,000 rows of data on disk. 
2. Set the program to process the data less than 40,000. 
3. Observe the following operations: 
  a. Save the file as a temp file. 
  b. Call the file to memory. 
  c. Sort the data. 
  d. Save the file to temp file.
